plugins.name: bb-extract

Now, you can seamlessly integrate design tokens directly into your codebase, making it a breeze to maintain a consistent design system. Simplify your design workflow and boost collaboration with this powerful plugin today!

plugins.name: Freaking Fake Data
plugins.description:
About plugin:

Freaking Fake Data simplifies your design workflow in Figma, FigJam and Slides by letting you fill mockups with custom, project-specific data instead of random content. Take control of your text layers, create tailored datasets and unify data formats for your design team â€” perfect for consistent names, phone numbers or other details. Working locally, it boosts productivity and eliminates errors while speeding up mockup creation.


Key Features:

  1. Effortless Mockup Filling: Quickly populate text layers with your data.
  2. Unified Team Data: Import a CSV or JSON file for team consistency.
  3. Bulk Text Magic: Mass-apply text to layers with one click.
  4. Cross-Platform Support: Works in Figma, FigJam and Slides.
  5. Easy Data Import: Upload CSV or JSON files instantly.
  6. Default Data Option: Test with preloaded samples (e.g., names, cities).


How to Use:

  1. Import Data: Create a table in a tool like Google Sheets or Excel, fill it with data, export as CSV or JSON, and uploadâ€”or use default data. Import multiple files and switch via tabs.
  2. Select Text Layers: Highlight the text layers to apply data to.
  3. Apply Data: Pick a column (e.g., "First Name") and apply data. Choose order:
  4. Sort: Inserts data in table order.
  5. Random: Inserts data in random order.
  6. Explore Options: Switch tabs, view rows, or use "Set as Default" to save a tab for next launch.


How to Create a Table:

  1. Enter data in columns (e.g., "First Name" in one, "City" in another); the first row becomes button names.
  2. Add separators by leaving a column empty with "---" or "- - -" in the header for a line or use "//Special Offers" or "// Special Offers" for a labeled group divider. (example: telegram)


Perfect for prototypes, presentations or team projects â€” try it now!
plugins.tagline: Fill Mockups Quickly â€” use unified data for your design team. Massively paste your text into Figma

plugins.name: PRE: AI Design Review
plugins.description:
PRE helps designers and product teams understand how users will interact with their UI designs â€” before a single line of code is written.


ðŸ”¹ Select any frame in Figma and click â€œUpload Selected Frameâ€ to send it to PRE.

ðŸ”¹ PRE will automatically generate a heatmap, predict click-through rates, and provide UX suggestions using AI.

ðŸ”¹ You can modify the generated tags, draw additional clickable elements, or toggle the heatmap overlay on and off using the second button in the top bar.

ðŸ”¹ Once you're happy with the predictions, you can download the heatmap and click data for further analysis or presentation.


Whether you're working on early wireframes or high-fidelity mocks, PRE helps you make design decisions backed by predictive user analytics â€” all from right inside Figma.


Powered by PRE

plugins.name: Zuuvi Export Service
plugins.description:
Zuuvi Export Service is a Figma plugin designed to integrate Figma with Zuuviâ€™s Studio platform, making it easier and more efficient for designers who work with both tools. The plugin helps reduce the need to manually recreate designs in Studio after first mocking them up in Figma. While built around Figmaâ€™s capabilities, the exported result aims to reflect the original design as closely as possible within the constraints of Studioâ€™s features.


Easily export ad creatives from Figma directly into your Zuuvi workspace - ready for production, personalisation, and cross-channel publishing.

Whether you're designing HTML5 banners, social media ads, retail media formats or in-store screens, this plugin helps creative teams move faster and stay in control.


ðŸ”§ What You Can Do with the Zuuvi Plugin:

  1. Export static or layered ad designs directly from Figma to Zuuvi
  2. Optimise for use across display, social, retail media, DOOH, video, and more
  3. Support for production-ready HTML5 ad creatives
  4. Maintain template structure and layer control for streamlined animation workflows


ðŸš€ Why Use Zuuvi for Your Ad Production?

Zuuvi is a Creative Performance Platform that empowers marketers and designers to:


  1. Build high-quality, high-performing HTML5 ads at speed
  2. Personalise and localise creatives across channels and markets
  3. Scale ad production without adding design overhead
  4. Centralise all ad formats - from social media creatives to dynamic banners - in one platform


ðŸ“š Documentation & Support

Full plugin guide and step-by-step tutorials: https://help.zuuvi.com/en/articles/10774913-how-to-export-from-figma-to-zuuvi-studio


Questions? Reach out anytime via our live chat or care@zuuvi.com


ðŸ§© Requirements

To use this plugin, an active Zuuvi account is required.

Not a user yet? Learn more and book a demo here.


ðŸ”’ Data Security

We value your creative integrity and your data privacy. Zuuvi follows best practices for security, and all plugin exports are processed securely through your Zuuvi account.


Design in Figma. Scale in Zuuvi.

From idea to high-performing ad campaign â€“ Zuuvi makes creative production fast, scalable, and impactful.
plugins.tagline: Convert your Figma designs to omnichannel ad campaigns

  2. å›¾åƒå°†æ˜¾ç¤ºåœ¨å›ºå®šå¤§å°çš„é¢„è§ˆæ¡†å†…ï¼Œç¼©æ”¾è®¾ç½®ä¼šæ ¹æ®æ‚¨çš„å¼€å…³é€‰æ‹©è¿›è¡Œåº”ç”¨ã€‚

Introduction

Image Size Integration allows Figma users to efficiently manage and integrate images within frames, groups, and components. With this plugin, you can adjust image sizes and apply uniform dimensions for a consistent design output.


Function Description

  1. Allows users to select multiple elements (Frames, Groups, Components, Text, Instances, etc.) in a Figma design.
  2. Automatically calculates the maximum width and height from the selected elements.
  3. Displays each selected image inside a preview box, either maintaining its original size or resizing it based on the longest side, as determined by the user's settings.
  4. A toggle feature to switch between maintaining the image's original size or scaling it to fit the preview box.
  5. Supports flexible control over how images are displayed within their allocated preview space.


How to Use

  1. Select the elements (Frames, Groups, Text, Components, Instances, etc.) you want to preview and adjust.
  2. Click the "Generate Base64 Preview" button to create image previews.
  3. Use the toggle to switch between keeping the imageâ€™s original size or scaling it to fit the preview box.
  4. View the adjusted images and their corresponding dimensions directly within the plugin's interface.


Notes

  1. The plugin supports both raster images and vector elements.
  2. Images will be displayed in a fixed-size preview box, and resizing settings apply based on your toggle choice.
  3. The plugin works with selected elements in Figma's canvas, so ensure you have the right items selected before applying the tool.

Quickly save and reuse design resources without creating components.


You can:

  1. Save frequently used icons, components, images, and all design elements.
  2. Quickly create clones.
  3. Backup design drafts on a separate page to keep your workspace organized.

  3. It also does not support calling design content across different files.

plugins.name: OS converter
plugins.description:
Stop duplicating your work! Convert entire flows or single frames between iOS and Android in seconds â€” no more tedious manual adjustments.


Why OS Converter?

Designers are often faced with a choice:

  1. Design in one OS and leave conversions to developers
  2. Manually recreate each flow for both platforms


With OS Converter, you get the best of both worlds â€” fast, accurate, and hassle-free conversion.


How it works:

  1. Set up your components â€“ Use a variant property named "OS" with values "iOS" and "Android"
  2. Run the plugin â€“ When your layouts are ready to convert
  3. Click to swap! â€“ Convert single frames or entire flows in one click

plugins.name: Case Shifter
plugins.description:
Overview

Streamline your design workflow with the Frame Renamer plugin for Figma! This tool allows you to quickly and efficiently rename frame names, making it especially useful when organizing and exporting layers.


Features

  1. Quick Rename: Easily rename frames in bulk, saving time and effort.
  2. Organize Layers: Keep your Figma projects neat and well-organized by using consistent naming conventions.
  3. Efficient Exporting: Simplify your exporting process by standardizing layer names, reducing errors and improving efficiency.


Supported Naming Conventions

The Frame Renamer currently supports the following cases:

  1. camelCase: e.g., frameNameExample
  2. snake_case: e.g., frame_name_example
  3. kebab-case: e.g., frame-name-example
  4. PascalCase: e.g., FrameNameExample


Future Updates

We are continually working to improve the Frame Renamer plugin. Stay tuned for more features and naming conventions in future updates!
plugins.tagline: Transform your Layer name, one case at a time.

plugins.name: Padding Check
plugins.description: Are developers always at your back since your paddings are always not multiples of 4? This plugin solves this problem of yours where you can quickly identify the Figma frames with the said padding issues. The plugin has a very simple UI where we have info display section and 2 buttons. 1st button "Highlight frames" selects all problematic frames and brings them to your view (Shift+1) and the 2nd button "Mark frames" creates a red box around all the frames that have a padding issue. The good news is that this plugin works only for Auto layout frames and not for all frames thereby not giving you unwanted results. As a helper once the plugin is executed (either of the buttons used to find the frames with issues) The information section of the plugin UI displays the count of the frames with issues helping the user to quickly take account of the issue.
plugins.tagline: Are all paddings in your Figma file multiples of 4? Use this plugin to quickly identify if not!

plugins.name: ProdMax
plugins.description:
Prodmax - 10X Your Ideas into Software Execllence


ProdMax is an innovative intelligent frontend development platform that seamlessly integrates with both Web interfaces and Figma plugins to transform design mockups into high-quality frontend code. The platform aims to significantly enhance development efficiency, foster team collaboration, and streamline the design-to-development workflow.


Use Case:


Step 1. User Authentication

  1. Users complete secure authentication through the account-password login system to access the platform workspace

Step 2. Intelligent Component Creation

  1. Select target layers in the Figma interface
  2. Click the "New Biz Component" button to initiate component creation
  3. Add professional naming and functional descriptions for the component
  4. View corresponding DSL node structures in the component details page
  5. Support editing or deleting created components as needed

Step 3. Intelligent Page Construction

  1. Select page-level layers in Figma
  2. Click the "New Page" button to initiate page creation
  3. Add semantic naming and functional descriptions for the page
  4. View complete DSL node structures in the page details interface
  5. Support editing or deleting created pages as needed

plugins.name: Spacing and radius fixer
plugins.description:
Auto-fix spacing & radius

Plugin that automatically rounds spacing and radius values to the nearest preset value in Auto Layout objects.


What it does

- Rounds gap and padding values to the nearest preset spacing

- Rounds corner radius to the nearest preset radius

- Works with any Auto Layout object (frames, components, instances)


Presets

Default values (can be customized in plugin):

Spacing: 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 16, 20, 24, 32, 40, 48, 56, 64, 80 (px)

Radius: 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 16, 20, 100 (px)


How to use

1. Select Auto Layout object(s)

2. Run the plugin

3. Switch between Spacing/Radius modes

4. Customize presets if needed (or use Reset to restore defaults)

5. Click Apply
plugins.tagline: Fixes inconsistent spacing and radius values by rounding them to the nearest preset

plugins.name: FigCrawl
plugins.description:
FigCrawl: Your FigJam Content Extractor


What is FigCrawl?

FigCrawl is a powerful FigJam plugin that transforms your collaborative boards into structured, AI-ready data. It intelligently extracts and organizes all your board's content while preserving the visual hierarchy and relationships between elements.


Use Cases

For Designers & Teams

  1. Extract structured content from brainstorming sessions
  2. Convert visual collaboration into actionable data
  3. Document and archive board content
  4. Share board content in a structured format


For AI/LLM Integration

  1. Feed board content into AI tools
  2. Generate summaries and reports
  3. Analyze relationships between ideas
  4. Create structured documentation


For Documentation

  1. Export board content for documentation
  2. Create structured reports
  3. Archive important board sessions
  4. Share insights with stakeholders



How It Works

  1. Launch: Open the plugin in your FigJam board
  2. Extract: Click "Extract Content" to scan your board
  3. Review: See a summary of extracted content
  4. Copy: Choose to copy the entire board or individual pages
  5. Use: Paste the JSON into your preferred AI tool or LLM
plugins.tagline: Extract FigJam content into AI-ready data with one click
